description: Canonical, deuterocanonical, pseudepigraphal, and esoteric texts across religious traditions

canonical.name: Canonical Scripture
canonical.description: Authoritative scripture in one or more traditions

traditions.name: EO
traditions.description: Varies by jurisdiction, typically includes additional books

traditions.name: PR
traditions.description: 66 books - OT Hebrew canon plus NT

traditions.name: LDS
traditions.description: Bible plus Book of Mormon, D&C, Pearl of Great Price

traditions.name: AN
traditions.description: 66 books canonical; Apocrypha read for edification

traditions.name: CO
traditions.description: Similar to Eastern Orthodox with some variations

traditions.name: SY
traditions.description: Peshitta tradition with some unique texts

traditions.name: AC
traditions.description: 22-book NT canon (excludes 2 Pet, 2-3 John, Jude, Rev)

sections.name: Old Testament Shared Canon and Deuterocanonical Books
sections.description: Books shared across Christian and Jewish traditions

sections.name: Ethiopian Orthodox Canon and Distinctives
sections.description: Books unique to the Ethiopian Orthodox tradition

sections.name: Ethiopian Church Texts and Liturgical-Legal Collections
Jewish Pseudepigrapha, Wisdom, and Apocalyptic Literature
Second Temple Texts and the Dead Sea Scrolls
Early Church Fathers and Apostolic-Era Writings
Latter-day Saint Scripture
sections.description: Canonical writings unique to the LDS tradition

sections.name: Armenian Apostolic Distinctives
sections.description: Texts unique to or emphasized in the Armenian tradition

books.name: Josippon (chronicle)
books.notes: Preserved and used historically; not scripture

books.name: Sinodos
books.notes: Ethiopic church order and canonical regulations

books.name: Didascalia Apostolorum
books.notes: Apostolic church order; Ethiopic and Syriac reception

books.name: Psalm 151
books.notes: Present in Orthodox Psalters; used liturgically in Ethiopia

books.name: Prayer of Manasseh
books.notes: Penitential prayer; often transmitted in appendices

books.name: Life of Adam and Eve (Greek Apocalypse)
books.notes: Greek recension of the Adamic cycle

books.name: Life of Adam and Eve (Latin Vita)
Story of Ahikar
books.notes: Wisdom tale with Near Eastern transmission

books.name: 4 Maccabees
books.notes: Philosophical martyrdom; appended in Greek Orthodox settings

books.name: Community Rule (1QS)
books.notes: Qumran sectarian rule, initiation, and theology

books.name: Temple Scroll (11QT)
books.notes: Alternative temple legislation and cultic law

books.name: Thanksgiving Hymns (Hodayot, 1QH)
books.notes: Sectarian psalms of thanksgiving and lament

books.name: Songs of the Sabbath Sacrifice
books.notes: Angelic liturgy and heavenly temple mysticism

books.name: Midrash Rabbah
books.notes: Classical homiletical midrash on Torah and Megillot

books.name: Sifre
books.notes: Halakhic midrash on Numbers and Deuteronomy

books.name: Sefer Yetzirah
books.notes: Creation through letters and sefirotic structure

books.name: Discourse on the Ogdoad and Ennead
Didache
books.notes: Early church instruction and moral catechesis

books.name: Letter of Polycarp to the Philippians
Homilies on the Gospel of Matthew
On the Unity of Christ (Cyril of Alexandria)
Shepherd of Hermas
books.notes: Widely read in early Christianity; later excluded from formal canons

books.name: Epistle of Barnabas
books.notes: Early Christian exegesis and polemic; widely circulated

books.name: Ethiopic Apocalypse of Peter
books.notes: Heaven and hell visions in Ethiopic tradition

books.name: Psalm 151
books.notes: Expanded Davidic psalm beyond the Hebrew Psalter

books.name: Psalms 152-155
books.notes: Additional psalms preserved in Ethiopic and Syriac traditions

books.name: Gospel of Mary
books.notes: Early Christian mystical and revelatory themes

books.name: Biblical Odes (Odes Collection)
books.notes: Orthodox liturgical hymn cycle; may include Prayer of Manasseh

books.name: 4 Ezra (2 Esdras / 4 Esdras)
books.notes: Canonical status varies in EO; canonical in Ethiopian tradition

books.name: Martyrdom (Ascension) of Isaiah
books.notes: Jewish-Christian prophetic martyrdom and visionary ascent

books.name: Testament of Abraham
books.notes: Ethical narrative with angelic judgment motifs

books.name: Pseudo-Philo (Biblical Antiquities)
books.notes: Retelling of Israel's history with interpretive expansions

books.notes: Record of ancient American prophets; keystone of LDS faith

books.notes: Lehi's departure from Jerusalem; Nephi's vision

books.notes: Isaiah prophecies; Nephi's teachings on Christ

books.name: Jacob
books.notes: Allegory of the olive tree; warnings against pride

books.name: Enos
books.notes: Enos's wrestle with God in prayer

books.name: Alma
books.notes: Largest book; missionary journeys; war chapters

books.name: 3 Nephi
books.notes: Christ's ministry in Americas; Sermon at temple

books.name: 4 Nephi
books.notes: 200 years of peace after Christ's visit

books.name: Ether
books.notes: Jaredite record; brother of Jared's vision

books.name: Moroni
books.notes: Moroni's farewell; promise of the Spirit

books.name: Doctrine and Covenants
books.notes: Modern revelations to Joseph Smith and successors

books.notes: Collection including Moses, Abraham, JS-History, Articles of Faith

books.notes: Expanded Genesis account; visions of Moses

books.notes: Abraham's writings; cosmology and pre-mortal existence
